Graphics::TexturedQuad

Graphics::TexturedQuad Class Reference

List of all members.

Detailed Description

For internal use only.

Represents a quad (two triangles) with a texture (updatable dynamically)


Public Member Functions

Member Function Documentation

bool Graphics::TexturedQuad::init ( unsigned int  textureWidth,
unsigned int  textureHeight,
int  nChannels,
bool  render2D = false 
)

Initializes the class so it becomes valid.

For internal use only.

Parameters:
[in] textureWidth Width of the texture to show on the quad
[in] textureHeight Height of the texture to show on the quad
[in] nChannels Number of channels of the texture (1 -> Grayscale, 3 -> RGB, 4 -> RGBA )
[in] render2D If true, the textured quad is rendered in 2d, so it is overlayed to the 3d scene
Returns:
true if the initialization was ok | false otherwise

void Graphics::TexturedQuad::end (  ) 

Releases the class resources. After this method is called the class is not valid anymore.

For internal use only.

void Graphics::TexturedQuad::setPosition ( float  x,
float  y,
float  z = 0.0f 
)

For internal use only.

Sets the position in the scene of the textured quad

Parameters:
[in] x x coordinate of the new position
[in] y y coordinate of the new position
[in] z z coordinate of the new position

void Graphics::TexturedQuad::setVisible ( bool  visible  ) 

For internal use only.

Sets the texture quad as visible/invisible

Parameters:
[in] visible if true the quad will be visible

void Graphics::TexturedQuad::updateTexture ( unsigned char *  textureData,
unsigned int  width,
unsigned int  height,
unsigned short  channels 
)

Updates the texture pixel data.

For internal use only.

Parameters:
[in] textureData New pixel data to upload to the texture
[in] width Width of the new pixel data
[in] height Height of the new pixel data
[in] channels Channels of the new pixel data (RGB -> 3, RGBA -> 4)
